sections.purpose: To describe the standard operating procedure for the operation of Hot Air Oven for drying pharmaceutical materials, glassware sterilization, and heat treatment applications using dry heat.
sections.scope: Applicable to drying and heating activities carried out in the Pharmaceutics.
procedure: Ensure the hot air oven is placed on a stable surface with adequate clearance.
Verify that the oven is properly ventilated and away from flammable materials.
Check that shelves and trays are clean and properly positioned.
Inspect door seal and ensure proper closing mechanism.
Power ON the hot air oven using the main switch.
Set the desired temperature using the temperature controller.
Set the drying time using the timer if equipped.
Allow the oven to reach set temperature before loading materials.
Verify temperature using calibrated thermometer if required.
Arrange materials on trays ensuring proper air circulation.
Do not overload shelves or block air circulation vents.
Open the door and quickly load materials to minimize heat loss.
Close the door securely ensuring proper sealing.
Monitor temperature throughout the drying process.
Record temperature at regular intervals as per protocol.
After drying time completion, turn OFF the heating element.
Allow materials to cool inside the oven before opening door.
For heat-sensitive materials, open door slightly for gradual cooling.
Once materials reach safe handling temperature, remove them carefully.
Use heat-resistant gloves or tongs when handling hot items.
Clean the oven interior periodically to remove spills or residues.
Document temperature, time, and observations in the equipment logbook.
precautions: Do not place flammable or explosive materials in the oven.
Avoid overloading which restricts air circulation and uniform heating.
Never open the door suddenly when oven is at high temperature.
Use appropriate heat-resistant containers and trays.
Monitor temperature continuously for heat-sensitive materials.
Do not place wet materials directly without proper drip trays.
Ensure proper ventilation if drying materials that release vapors.
Wear heat-resistant gloves when handling hot materials.
Allow adequate cooling time before removing materials.
Perform regular calibration to ensure temperature accuracy.
